content.description: Start low on the obvious double crimp, pinches up and left, with some blind slaps left to the arete. This seems to be the route that most some people are doing in videos tagged as Hot Rats.
content.location: Start on the same obvious double crimp as Hot Rats but instead of going straight left through the roof, make your way up on pinches before traversing left to the Stiletto/Hot Rats finish.

content.description: Great movement, perpetually manky rock. Begin from a sit-start on the overhanging arete. Climb compression moves to a wet pocket below the lip. Either push it out, or grab the tree and walk off...as I did.
content.location: Within the maze of the sinkhole...

content.description: Start low on a flat shelf and climb up through a flake and some positive slopers to an even more slopey top-out slab. Finesse your body over the bulge and finish your way up the delicate top section.
content.location: Trend right on the trail through a few large, tall boulders with a very low angle slab to the right. This boulder is located directly through this corridor, the problem is located in the middle of the face.

content.description: Start on head-high jugs, heel and cross up and right to some smaller holds. Then toss to the lip, mantle, and scramble to the top.
content.protection: One or two crash pads should do it.
content.location: Take the trail right between two tall boulders. Walk past a slab on the right towards Sweet As, Man, then turn right.

content.description: Start matched on crimp underclings under the belly of the roof. Make a huge throw out to the left. Toe and heel hook your way directly out the underside of the belly.
content.location: Start on right side of roof belly. Climb under belly leftwards.

content.description: Find the good right hand undercling and left hand edge to start. Establish a foot, then follow slopers, seams, and jugs to the top. Lower variations are possible to spice things up a bit.
Start matched on two crimps down low. Pull some moves to get out to the arete out left. Same finish as Stilleto.
content.location: Same boulder as Stiletto. The start is down and right of the bulge.

content.description: Climb the offwidth chimney on the warm-up boulder. Shimmy your way up to the lip without using the arete.
content.location: On the warm-up boulder near Fire Up the Barbie and Hot Rats.

content.description: Start matched on a large flake and cross into an interesting plated-mushroom hold on the roof then move out the the large, positive sloper to the right. Establish on the sloper and move up through your choice of pockets and other holds to a jug and following top out.
content.location: This problem is directly right of Sweet As, Man. Look for the big sloper.

content.description: Surprisingly fun 2-3 move mantle problem. Establish in sidepulls and flip yer mitts for the mantle. I obviously do not claim an FA on this: if anyone knows the name of this route please let me know and I will edit this. Fun enough problem to share on here though.
The start to this problem is down low, on a right hand pinch and a left hand crimp. The first move is the crux, and you need to be careful to not dab on the boulder behind you. Fun arete climb.
content.location: To the left of Sweet As.

content.description:
The Sinkhole area is a recently developed and opened area just above the cliffline, partially removed from the rest of the main boulder field. It is currently home to 20-30 problems of a variety of grades. 

  If anyone knows the actual names of existing problems, please let me know so I can update them.
